title: Little Big Worlds: “Great music has the faintest notes. The great form is without shape.”
description:
I also have interest in lofty things, those impressive natural or artificial views.
The Locana Buddha, for example, was created by people in homage to their belief. It is a mighty figure crafted by ancient artisans with their flesh and blood and superb skills.
While, in the vast natural world, things created by nature are infinite, which is the cornerstone of progress in human intelligence.
In these photos, every tree, river or image is the focus, framed in scale to create a sense of awe.
My photos focus on both human progress and the tranquility of nature. As a quote by Robert Adams says, “The job of the photographer, in my view, is not to catalogue indisputable fact but to try to be coherent about intuition and hope.”
